reporting-org.narrative: Flemish Interuniversity Council for University Development Cooperation (VLIR-UOS)
Vlaamse Interuniversitaire Raad voor Universitaire Ontwikkelingssamenwerking (VLIR-UOS)

description.narrative: There is a longstanding history of cooperation between Ecuador and Flemish higher education institutions. Ecuador remains an important partner country with a high midrange budget. VLIR-UOS supports interventions that strengthen higher education, research and extension in various domains and with partners in different regions of the country. All interventions frame within the Country Strategy for Ecuador that aligns fully with the Ecuadorian national ‘Buen vivir’ strategy. The strategy is translated into the following main themes: Biodiversity/natural resources; Education; Health; Social Sciences ( incl. security issues, migration and intercultural topics); Food & Nutrition; Cultural Heritage. Transversal support themes are: university Management; strengthening of academic skills (scientific writing, statistic, Academic English, ...) and institutional capacity building. In the 2017-2021 period, the IUC with Universidad the Cuenca enters a phase out programme and the national Network of Biodiversity coordinated by ESPOL with strong support of UCuenca, EPN (Quito) and UTN (Ibarra) continues as a stronghold of cooperation. The urge of Ecuador of becoming a knowledge society is translated into a national crosscutting project on educational research with UNAE, the national pedagogic institute. The project has synergy with VVOB. Also 2 TEAM projects and 2 SIs started as from 2017. A number of new projects (TEAM, SI and JOINT) for Ecuador will still be selected in the 2017-2021 period.

participating-org.narrative: Flemish Interuniversity Council for University Development Cooperation (VLIR-UOS)

Universidad Católica de Santiago de Guayaquil
Universidad Laica Eloy Alfaro de Manabí
Universidad de las Fuerzas Armadas ESPE

title.narrative: Ecuadorean Higher Education Institutes have been empowered in their role as drivers of change by strengthening their threefold mission of research, education and extension (of new knowledge, applications and services) to society (continued).
Number of PhD students graduated directly supported by the project, contributing to the objectives of the project

Number of students or staff enabled in the areas of quality management (internal/external) (research & tech. Transfer policy, quality assurance, scientific writing, statistics for research, academic English, human resources management)

Ecuadorean Higher Education Institutes have been empowered in their role as drivers of change by strengthening their threefold mission of research, education and extension (of new knowledge, applications and services) to society.
Number of Master students graduated directly supported by the project, contributing to the objectives of the project
Number of articles published in national peer reviewed journals (through the support of the project)
Number of training module packages developed through the support of the project
Number of persons reached by presentations (community related) or extension workshops through the support of the project
Number of articles published in international peer reviewed journals (through the support of the project)
Number of new courses developed through the support of the project
Number of new or substantially updated Master programmes developed (curriculum) through the support of the project
Number of presentations (community related) or extension workshops organised through the support of the project
